description:
Fresh squeezed OJ and delicious huevos rancheros! 

They don't have cafes like this too much anymore in the city. This cafe serves your standard breakfast and lunch fare: pancakes, eggs, scrambles, delicious huevos rancheros, sandwiches and super friendly service. Down home, no frills, family friendly.  Brunch specials are yummy too: portobello Benedict is worth a try.
author: Liz C.

description: Awesome veggie farmers omelette! Homey feel and great service. Great local spot for a quick breakfast.
author: Lea C.

description:
Wow yumm.. My second time eating here.. Got the California crepe today with salad. Dressing lite n tasty..and geez I didn't see the seafood platter hmm.. Yumm I also want too.. Fried seafood why wouldn't you want some?? Should I ??? 
Weekends r crowded so come early for good parking too..
author: Crisy G.

description:
I really wanted to like Cafe Rain Tree but unfortunately, with other breakfast & brunch/American restaurants in the area, I don't think I will be back. 

I ordered the Milano Crepe with home fries ($11.25). Definitely not worth the money. The home fries were so soggy that they may as well have been mashed potatoes.  The crepe itself was a joke. There's really no other way to put it. The crepe had the texture of a tortilla. It felt like I was handed a tortilla that was folded with some mushrooms scattered inside. Crepes are usually filled with different ingredients on the inside. This crepe was nearly empty. The baby pieces of soggy potatoes were thicker than the crepe. And the marinara sauce on top of the crepe was like a runny, bland tomato soup. 

Service was great. That is their only saving grace, in my opinion. 

Not worth the money and sadly, I don't plan to come back.
author: Florence S.

description: I've been gone from San Francisco about 3 years now but this was my go-to spot. The food was affordable and tasty. The staff was friendly attentive and engaging.  This regular American fare won't exactly change the culinary game but they were consistently good. Not sure what more one could ask for. I do miss this place. The one thing that might be a bit off-putting might be the size of the space. I have given many a butt to the face as I shimmy between tables. It's kinda tight in there.
author: Herman T.

description:
First of all. I've been to several SMALL restaurants. but this one is super small if my stroller can BARELY get thru the tables. Isn't that some kind of hazard? If my stroller was barely making it how can a wheelchair????? My stroller has the ability to sit up 90 degrees. Usually if a chair is removed at the table, we just slide our stroller in and my son can sit in his stroller . Here, the tables are soooo close together that the back of my stroller is already at the next table. Therefore, the waitress asked me to "leave my stroller OUTSIDE" when they needed that table. Are you fuckin kidding me. My stroller isn't a cheap stroller so absolutely NOT am I leaving it outside. Of course, I was offended she asked me to do
this. So, we got up and left before ordering. I was clearly upset, weaving through the fuckin tables, again barely making it, and didn't even get an apology. They need to rearrange their dining area because I'm sure they are breaking all sorts of codes or hazards, whatever.
author: Sarina A.

description: Yuck, do not come here for a chef salad.  Utterly dreadful    Was envious of the table next to mine.  Their burgers and fries looked tasty.  The other table had breakfast that looked good too.  Just don't go salad!!!   The turkey was slippery and creepy.  Not large enough portion for the price too.  Won't be back.
author: Pauline C.

description: I wont be going to any of the rain tree cafes, unfortunately I found hair in my eggs at the irving location in the inner sunset.
author: Valeriana L.

description: Giving this 5 stars to bring up its rating! Cute, quiet place, inexpensive and simple good food. They have a huge menu and great options! Great if you like the diner feel and are tired of hipster expensive brunch places.
author: Katie N.

description:
This is our go-to breakfast place. I love the simplicity of the menu, non of that hipster menu stuff that ruins a simple bacon, toast with eggs breakfast like other locations (Manor Café) has at West Portal. Their Denver omelet isn't too bad either however when I want something more light I just stick to their Rain Tree Special #2.

It can get crowded if you arrive after 10:30 on weekends and sometimes you may even have to wait. It can get pretty hectic since the place isn't very big. The two waitresses that have been there the last few months are always on their toes while dealing with large parties or screaming kids who makes a big mess. The service can be a bit slow because of that, however once they get your order the food comes out pretty quickly and then there's the wait for your check again. 

There's a little bench you can sit inside of the café however you're sitting RIGHT NEXT to customers who are dining. So for either you're waiting for an empty table or whether you're trying to enjoy your meal, it is not very comfortable to be in that close of a vicinity of you while you're eating. We usually just wait outside of the line isn't too long.
author: Fanny W.

description: I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews here! Even though, it was a little slow the food was pretty good. My friends from San Diego were visiting this weekend and my roommate suggested this place. There was 8 of us (it's a super tiny restaurant) and they made room for us as best as they could. As for the food, I got an omelette with mushrooms, spinach, avocado, and bacon. It came with home fries and an English muffin. It's a nice and cozy place to be. I may come back in the future :)
author: Korra B.

description:
I think Cafe Rain Tree is underrated! I love this place, it's very homey and cozy and their crab cake Benedict is to die for.

I've looked everywhere for crab cake Benedict and I was ecstatic to see it on the menu here. The crab cakes are crispy, fresh and full of flavors, the poached eggs are always poached perfectly and the service is always friendly.

I've been here several times and while Manor Cafe (now "The Manor") has upped their prices and shrunk their portions, Cafe Rain Tree stands and serves good ol' plates of delicious food. 

Service here has been great as well, especially the wonderful waiter that was there the last time I visited. He was nice, patient and friendly- we had a friend visiting from Japan so it took us longer to decide on our orders. He was not annoyed with us and was very kind when our friend ordered with broken English. Also, he looks like Adam Levine so that's always a plus lol 

I love Cafe Rain Tree and I will always give it 5 stars
author: Alyssa H.

description:
Recommendation: Go check out this comfortable neighborhood cafe for tasty affordable food.

Pros & Cons: I initially tried this place when the lines at nearby Toast were again too long (see my review of Toast) and I've chosen the Cafe Rain Tree over Toast ever since. The menu offers a little something for everyone, service is fast and friendly, the portions are large with fresh ingredients, and everything is relatively affordable. Interactions between staff like Regina and customers reflect the neighborhood feel of the cafe with many of the conversations sounding like old friends catching up. I'm also impressed by how accommodating the staff are to special requests, changes, omissions, and additions to the basic menu. The environment is simple, clean, and comfortably worn. The food can be somewhat under seasoned which allows the diner to adjust accordingly so not really a complaint. I do have one very small complaint which is, for some odd reason, the ketchup bottles I have touched have been sticky but that most certainly will not keep me from coming back for a meal or two every week which is always very tasty!
author: Thatwasme T.

description: Can't believe that cafe has the amazing location but the worst food in the world. It was totally waste of money, I couldn't even eat my scrambled egg!(how one can mess up single scrambled egg recipe,really??). Although it smelled awful inside, we didn't wanna wait in the line for other restaurants so we wanted to eat here. No wonder why the cafe was so empty after today's experience. Never coming back here again.
author: Dilan Ş.

description: They served me under cooked eggs. I understand eggs Benedict is runny, but I've never had uncooked egg white served to me. Gross. But the server is really sweet and my boyfriend enjoyed his food!
author: Casey C.

description: ZERO STARS! You're better off going to IHOP. Food is horrible, they can't even follow their own menu in the kitchen, they just throw together what they find and serve it. Service is also lacking and hard to communicate when they don't speak English.
author: Dave C.

description:
Great for a traditional pancake breakfast without the all SF BS and food snobbery. For $9.25 you get two delicious classic fluffy pancakes, 2eggs and a tasty sausage/bacon. 
When the bill came it was only $22 for two ppl I was really blown away. At ZAzzies I've easily paid over $40 for breakfast a pancake for only two ppl.  Yes it was tasty but too expensive and don't get me started on the wait time. Anyway, give it a try.
author: A V.

description: At first glance this place seems on quaint but after eating here I found myself at a loss for words. The fluidity of walking around inside is a bit difficult. I appreciate the attempt to make things easy as far as open aisles but it just doesn't work. The inside painting is also BAD. Either there needs to be a new coat of paint or the walls need to have so art. The walls just seem bare. The menu is decent for the style of food being served. More hires would be a GREAT addition as well. The experience here was .
author: Robert F.

description: It's good to eat a nice fairly priced breakfast/brunch here. The huevos rancheros tasted good.
author: Sebastian M.

description:
I don't really know where to begin. This place is strikingly average for a breakfast place...

My Greek omelette featured tomatoes, feta cheese, and artichoke hearts. It was served with home fries and a side of toast. The plate was huge! The omelette was really good, perfect balance of creamy from the cheese and tang from the marinated artichoke hearts. However, my home fries were mushy/soggy...a real downer. I ended up taking this home as leftovers and refried them the next day...it was much better then.

My mom opted for the Monte Carlo. The French toast was soggy...possibly from the juice released from the ham? The cheese was also congealed by the time it came to the table. The jam that was brought over? It was in a container that definitely looked like it had it shared multiple times over, the spoon inside looked so gross - it was littered with toast crumbs. Mom opted to not use it, but said that having no jam on the Monte Carlo really ruined the experience. Her order came with a side of salad which came with wilted pieces of lettuce drowning in dressing. Sad.

All in all, I wouldn't say that the food is bad...but it's not really worth it when I can produce the same quality at home.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
We went here for breakfast because the nearby Squat & Gobble had a very long line.
It was pretty full but we got a nice table along the wall.
Our server promptly brought us coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice.
My partner had the Mexican scramble which is filled with bacon, ham and sausage.  He liked it pretty well.
I had a Belgian waffle which was perfectly cooked - crispy on the outside and soft inside.  It was very good although I would have preferred if it came with sliced strawberries and whipped cream rather than syrup.
All in all, it was a pretty good, decent breakfast and we might return someday.
author: Philip C.

description:
I live in this neighbor and I always pass by here so I thought I should give it a try. You have to find your own table to sit down. They don't greet you either. So You have to find your own way out to sit down (it could be clean or dirty hopefully they get to clean your table) and wait for menu (took them 10mins) and wait another few 10-15 to take your orders. 
Very very slow service. Only one waitress running the hall. Busy or not either way they are slow. 
But food is pretty fresh and good. 
Oils are clean. 
Overall, decent breakfast spot with extremely slow service.
author: Stella K.

description: I'm sorry but this place makes Denny's look like a Michelin star restaurant. Never coming back.
author: Anari M.

description:
Took my brother here for lunch the day after Christmas and ordered myself an avocado BLT. 

The menu they have has a great selection of foods to choose from. Crepes, burritos, sandwiches, different sides, etc. Unfortunately the food fell a little short of my expectations. The BLT I had was good (the fries too), but it was nothing amazing. The bacon was a bit too overcooked and crunchy, but I suppose I should have mentioned how I like my bacon cooked. Also my brother didn't enjoy his burrito very much. I forget what he ordered, but it had shrimp, black beans, rice and some other stuff in it. I didn't try it myself, but I trust his judgement. 

Food aside, the service was excellent. Real friendly couple of guys who work here and the food was ready in less than ten minutes.
author: Tory J.

description: I'd frequent the Raintree on West Portal a lot more if they offered wi-fi. Such a simple and thoughtful addition, and it would greatly increase the number of patrons. This is what keeps me from being a regular.
author: Ami G.

description: I go here all the time with my boyfriend and we are never disappointed. We get the same waitress every time and she is a sweetheart. We've been helped by other people as well and they were great too, everyone works really hard. The food is exactly what I expect-- obviously it's not gourmet food, but the menu has everything I like and the atmosphere is so comfortable and calm that I just love coming here.
author: B V.

description:
The service here left my boyfriend and I speechless (much like the posts below).

First- we walk into the restaurant and were greeted by no one. We are finally seated and the waitress asked what we wanted without even giving us menus. We then ordered a milkshake and no joke, the waitress returned after 10 minutes and said "I just can't make this right now." We then ordered our food which looked so unappealing the waitress looked at us both, took the uneaten plates and said "you don't have to pay for that." ... So we left.
author: Danielle L.

description: Small restaurant frequented by the locals. Food is generic breakfast with a few Mexican inspired dishes. I feel the food has gotten better compared to the past.  Food service is a little slow.  There are only about 4 staff members working (cook, 2 waitress and a dishwasher) this little place. Hubby likes the place for standard diner food and it's really casual.  One unsanitary thing I saw was the waitress used the same towel she wiped the tables with to wife off excess syrup from the pancake syrup dispenser.
author: Ry T.

description:
What is wrong with you guy about this place? Why only one star???

I have been eating here for almost three years.... at least once a week. My favorites are the Californian with potato salad and a big glass of orange juice. 

The food is delicious. The waitresses are super nice and fast. They are very very attentive, and polite saying hi and bye all the time.

The were times I sent back the dishes, and the new food has been brought back. They corrected it. 

What else do you need more............ people?
author: Bentley K.

description: Since Manor closed there hasn't really been any place to get a good breakfast in WP.(Toast is expensive and not very good. Squat and Gobble chose that name and menu, plus the people they attract, ew.)  My mother in law was in town for a week and not being able to ever please her, I don't try. We needed somewhere to eat and Rain Tree really came through for us. If you only come here for breakfast the food is actually really good! The banana pancakes are delicious.
author: Corey Jace W.

description:
Mediocre omelette but great pancakes. Service was decent. 
Coffee can be better.
Potatoes were dry and lacked in flavor 

Over all - average
author: Milana R.

description: Solid breakfast joint-- selection of omelettes, benedicts, and waffles. The food is decent though nothing to write home about. I myself ordered the crab cake Benedict-- sub par// egg was poached-over-cooked. Great for a casual out on the town breakfast/ brunch. I liked some of the paintings and pieces hanging on the wall; looks like there's a homey touch.
author: Alexander T.

description: Rain Tree Restaurant--Why no love for this great little restaurant?? This is a "great" little place in the West Portal Area. I took my Wife, Kids, and Parents for lunch. The all day breakfast is tasty and fresh!! Omelettes and House Fries are the best.  The pancakes, bacon, and sausage are spot on. The French Fries are the best! Not limp and greasy. Perfect diner style French Fries. The Mushroom Burger is huge and taste great. If you're looking for comfort food and value for your money, go here for a nice meal. The waitresses are always super nice and attentive. The cooks are also very friendly and if something is not right, no problem they'll fix it.
author: Frankie F.

description: Very disappointed. This used to be my go-to breakfast place in West Portal. Today I ordered Eggs Florentine, which came covered in paprika, to which I am allergic. Rather than fixing it, the waitress took away my plate, and my water (!), with an angry gesture when I said I wouldn't eat something that would make me sick. I will never eat there, or rather attempt to eat there, again. I guess that's why it was nearly empty at noon.
author: Roberta S.

description: I feel like this is one of those places that gets business because of its convenience to the neighborhood and cheap prices. There's absolutely nothing memorable about the food here. The place is like you're ordinary diner and so is the quality of the food. On the bright side, they serve breakfast all day (can't really mess that up terribly). Overall, nothing special about this place. It's just convenient and very affordable. However, next time I would definitely chose Manor Cafe, which is a block down, over this cafe.
author: Reina C.

description: Wow, my hubby & I stopped in early Sunday morning. We were going to Art's but it was not open yet. We were the first customers of the day. This was a big mistake. The counter was dirty, didn't wipe down the night before? The menu looked interesting so we gave it a try.The food was tasteless. I stuck with the basics.  Home fries, just potatoes, eggs cooked on a to hot of a grill. and ham slice. Salt & pepper just made it salty. Hubby had their Irish Special, ha ha ha I would rather not go in to detail there because I don't know what the heck that was on his plate. Every thing there is old. The plastic cups are all pitted and scratched up. The coffee creamer leaked all over the counter. And no one cares. The $30 breakfast tab was not worth it at all. I will never come here again for anything.
author: Carmen R.

description:
I went with a small group of friends the other night and absolutely loved it. Super diverse menu, something for everyone. I didn't have high expectations, but was pleasantly surprised. I had the shrimp fettuccine pasta and absolutely loved it. My friends said they all enjoyed their meals. There were also vegetarian friendly options which was great. 
I'm definitely looking forward to bringing my family there.
author: Emma H.

description: Chicken pasta dish was brutal. Few bits of chicken, covered in a cheesy sauce. Wouldn't feed it to my dog.
author: Dónal B.

description: Ordered a burger with potato salad. The plate came out and I couldn't believe what they served me. It was a frozen style burger which was over done, inbetween two slices of bread with no lettuce, tomato etc in sight.... And as for the potato salad it tasted like they bought it from Safeway 3 weeks prior. Below average service and very poor food.
author: Aaron L.

description: Came here for breakfast on a Monday morning. Only 2 tables were taken so I was able to score the table at the window. I ordered the pork chop and egg breakfast - I ordered the eggs over medium and they came out pretty runny and the county potatoes could have used some seasoning. The pork chop that thin but flavorful and the sourdough toast was good. Coffee was good. Service was good. There is nothing special about this place.
author: Bumble B.

description:
My cousin and I wanted Italian down the street, but the lines were ugly. At this point, we just wanted to have a nice chat over dinner - no fuss, no muss. I think we got lucky here, cuz I was really "sketch." about this place as my cousin and I were wandering by; on the other hand, it was a crapshoot since neither of us knew of anything else in the neighborhood that we had previously tried.

Definitely nondescript-looking, and definitely a breakfast-type place. Since it wasn't crowded here, and the other places were, I was semi-worried. I went with the least-specialized-food-item-that-is-harder-to-screw-up in the form of a cheeseburger and fries, and my cousin went with the salmon. 

Surprisingly, they asked me how I wanted the meat cooked, and I took another deep risk and ordered it in my favorite way - "rare" - I said. I was still internally worried, since the place was "sketch" AND I ordered meat "rare". On the other hand, you only live once, and you might as well order it in the way that you want it!

I was pleasantly surprised. They cooked it rare and to perfection, and the burger was actually very decent; fries weren't bad, either.  My cousin mentioned that her salmon was OK.

The thing that we were laughing hysterically about, though, was that my cousin ordered a glass of white wine. Now, if you saw this place on the outside, and in, you wouldn't be too sure about ordering wine here. There's a difference between vintage, or original, versus - just plain old and rinky-dink - which is exactly how the wine tasted. We were lauging hysterically wondering, "what was she thinking...ordering wine from a place that probably bought it in a box!!"

I actually say all this lovingly cuz they exceeded my expecations. Since we were the only ones in there, service was actually OK. Decor left a lot to be desired and seemed slightly chintzy. Would I come here again? Prob yes! ...to have a burger, but not apt to try anything else - esp because of the reviews here.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Excellent food and service at good prices. If you are looking for good atmosphere and hot made to order food look no further
Yum
author: Maggie R.

description:
Raintree looks run down and a little sad, but as others have pointed out it's rarely busy and the food's not bad. Pretty cheap too.
I had a patty melt the other night that was really delicious, although the accompanying fries were kind of limp and mushy. My 2 companions had crepes which they really enjoyed. 
I wouldn't rush back but I'd give 'em another shot.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: Good breakfast except bacon was previously cooked and old. Good coffee. Little expensive but was west portal after all. I'll go again.( Fresh cook the bacon!)
author: David U.

description: Good food. Mom and Pop dinner. Great service despite being busy and only two servers. The food was delicious as well. Highly recommend.
author: Jose M.

description: Not busy on a Saturday but with only one waitress and it seemed like one cook. I noticed a help wanted sign so maybe they are understaffed. Self seating with menus on each table. Took a while to get my order in. My Cajun sausage really only tasted like any typical hot link. A little too much oil in fact. But the waitress was sweet. I left in the middle of my brunch to put more coins in the parking meter and she understood and was not suspicious of me dine and dashing. I also heard another table exclaiming how good their Mexican food was. I may come back to try something else.
author: Eileen F.

description: Sitting here now with the kiddos enjoying a killer monte cristo and fries combo. Best fries I've had since moving here. True diner style food. Very kid friendly.
author: Virginia H.

description:
This place sucks for the prices they have. The best thing I had was their pan cakes. 
The floor was littered with trash and food. 
My boyfriend and I came in and were looking for a place to sit, all the tables were dirty so we just sat at one. The waitress cleaned it and said she would bring us silverware. She didn't. We ordered and waited a very long time for our food to arrive. When it did I wished that we could send it back and leave. My beef and shrimp burrito was completely bland, the waitress provided no salsa for the 8 or 9 chips that came on the side. My boyfriend ordered one of the specials. Their was nothing special about it. Two eggs, very watery, in a bowl. Two WELL done pieces of bacon and two flapjacks with butter n sugar. No syrup provided until she came back and we asked her for some. I started eating as my boyfriend sat there, oh yea she never brought us that silverware. I walked to the other side of the restaurant and grabbed two table settings off the single set table in the whole restaurant. The eggs and bacon were what they were, the pancakes were good.
author: Sam S.

description:
It's not that the food was terrible, it's just I've had so much better. 

- When I first came in, I stood around for awhile and called out a couple of times to the workers but no one responded, even though it wasn't busy.
- The search for those rare little pieces of avocado in my avocado BLT and Cobb salad was great.
- $$$$. It was a $12 salad that left me still hungry and still confused as to why there was so little avocado in my salad.
author: Jingxi Z.

description: I came here to eat an the place was busy so I have to put my name on the list an had to wait witch was fine an as I was waiting some old people came in a as soon as a table open up they just sat down an the waiter did say anything just took there order an she knew we where waiting before them I had to way an extra 20 minutes after I just waited 15min I have there breakfast an there food wasn't even good my eggs where over cook an the pancakes where flat if you're looking to have a good breakfast i suggest you go to Toast there breakfast is 100 times better I will not be returning to this restaurant again.
author: Andy H.

description:
Run away from any burger and fries combo they have.  I ordered the guacamole burger and fries to go, it was bland and unseasoned.  The fries tasted like they've been in the freezer for 3 months to long.  I wanted to throw it against my dash while eating in the car it was that bad (but I had restraint).

To find this type of quality in SF is unnerving.
author: Kevin H.

description:
I usually don't do this but I feel obligated to give a fair warning to anyone out there tempted to dine here. Hopefully someone on their staff will read this and take the initiative to make a change. The first time I ate here for breakfast I ordered a simple WAFFLE, my boyfriend got his breakfast and the waitress said mine would be right out... After about ten minutes she returned and said they had to make me a new one... So by the time I got mine, his meal was cold from sitting there for 15+ minutes. We figured mistakes happen and we finished our meal and left. 

Last weekend we returned for, what we were hoping, to be a quick, easy, redemption breakfast... After sitting without even being acknowledged for over ten minutes we were finally greeted. We quickly ordered our very simple breakfasts... And then we waited... And waited... After over 20 minutes the waitress (the same one who had blatantly forgotten my waffle the previous time) returns and says "sorry I just put your order in". We got up and left. We will it be returning. The unprofessionalism and just  overall lack of attention by the staff is enough to turn customers away.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Seating is cozy. Service felt a little slow, but they were also busy (Saturday morning rush). Food was alright. I had 2 eggs with potatoes and toast. Not anything outstanding, but good if you're just trying to grab a bite
author: Tatum H.

description:
We are locals. Cannot recommend this place.

My girlfriend and I sat down.... No one acknowledged us, we waited 15 minutes without being helped. 

Another party of four seemed to have the same experience, except they were sitting at the counter and ignored by more employees than we were.

The waitress made eye contact, walked near us but never even bothered to ask out drink order... So we got up and went to a well rated place down the street and were helped immediately.

A shamefully run business. Please visit some of the more polite and well run businesses in the area. There are plenty. Please see my other reviews if you need to be pointed in the right direction.
author: Brett H.

description: This place is amazing! We were acknowledged and seated right away. The food in the pictures is accurate. It's exactly as expected. I wasn't expecting anything extreme just nice and simple, straight-to-the-point type food and atmosphere. I would go here again
author: Alysia Z.

description:
This review is based on the Rain Tree in West Portal only

Here's the thing about West Portal.  We're spoiled here.  District 7's got a whole lotta good brunch spots.  Until recently, we had 5 solid breakfast/brunch places (add Fresca's brunch during the weekends).  But since the unfortunate fire of Squat and Gobble a few weeks ago and Cafe for All Season's loss of their lease, us poor West Portalians are faced with the challenge to choose between Manor Coffee, Village Grill, and Cafe Rain Tree.  (Oh, gosh, whatvever shall we do?!?!) I had gone to Manor twice in one week, and Village Grill the day prior so Cafe Rain Tree was a nice refreshing change.  

It was a Sunday morning, and Rain Tree was also the least packed amongst the remaining West Portal breakfast spots.  We had come in literally right before the rush occurred.  And what from what I saw, there were two waitresses hustlin'.  As mentioned in prior reviews, I've had a handful of years devoted within the hospitality industry.  Within the ins and outs... from back of the house prep to front of the house bartending, I've done it all- So I respect a good tag-team of waitresses running the floor like a sweet dance.  These girls both did it with an understandably forced smile but not with any impatience nor irritation at the heavy flow of customers entering the restaurant.  Hands down, I respect it.

The coffee took awhile, but I kept note of how busy they were.  I only had to ask them once after ordering food for our coffee-  I ordered the Raintree special and opted for the french toast with bacon, while my guy ordered banana pancakes  with sausage.  My order came in perfect, however came out as blueberry pancakes.  No biggie for us, I just gave him one of my french toasts while he waited for the right pancakes, which came out in no less than 10 minutes

Perhaps this review is biased, but again, I favor those establishments that are run like a well oiled machine.  In my book, these girls earn that 20% tip hustle and while the food is mediocre in comparison to the other brunch head honchos out in West Portal, I will still find myself here on occasion should Manor be closed, Village Grill be packed or if Squat and Gobble is still burned down.  

xoxo ladies! 

P.S.- Perhaps if they had a cashier to do the reciepts, it would be smoother?  I saw an older gentlemen, which I believe to be the owner around the floor helping around (He dropped off the correct pancakes to us)
author: Cat A.

description:
This place is pretty pricy considering their food looks suspiciously like it came from CostCo. Maybe I'm wrong?

The clientele were on the creepy side too, but I guess that's not up to Rain Tree to decide.

Not that I'd ever eat here again, but I don't feel it deserves less than three stars. It's crappy diner food, and if you know that going in then you'll probably agree that it's average.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
It's a slightly above average diner.
But it gets all the stars because the coffee is pretty good.
I don't know why all these SF diners use Peerless Coffee.  It tastes like garbage juice.  Whatever Raintree is using is pretty good.
author: Patrick A.

description: Chef's salad was fine with crisp lettuce, real bacon, avocado, and blue cheese.  Tasty French bread also came with the salad.  Good service during weekday lunch.
author: J B.

description: Went here this morning for breakfast and it was very pleasant. Had the special with banana pancakes, eggs etc. The pancakes were excellent, with generous amounts of banana cooked in the batter. The coffee was fine for diner coffee. The service was very friendly and unobtrusive. I'm surprised by all the negative reviews.
author: Warzie L.

description: I ordered a chicken Cesar salad not really knowing what to expect. When it came I was pleasantly surprised. The grilled chicken was delicious and the lettuce was fresh. Great find!
author: E L.

description:
I come here once in a while with my boyfriend for breakfast. We like casual breakfast places with traditional items , like pancakes and omelets and whatnot. This place is great for a casual breakfast and you don't need to worry about dressing up or looking like you didn't just roll out of bed. 
It's great for kids and groups; its a bit noisy but only when it's super busy.
The waitress (i don't know her name) that seems to be there a lot is fantastic. She is constantly running around serving everyone because it seems like its only her working or one other person. She is so friendly and I really admire how she can stay so cheerful when shes serving like 30 hungry people mostly by herself. 
I recommend this place if you want to feel comfortable eating in a non- pretentious place.
author: Marie B.

description: The New York steak sandwich was cooked like a gum without any sauce and taste. I felt I had a trash.!
author: Zhi Z.

description:
We came in and the place was packed for brunch. There was only one waitress. I didn't mind the wait for menus, or the 10 or so minutes it took for her to come back to offer drinks and get our order. The drinks came out and so did the food, in a hurry. However, the omelette I ordered was horribly made, raw in the inside, brown and overcooked on the outside. They used American cheese instead of the cheddar I requested, so I had to send it back.  

The next one was also overcooked and brown, and the cheese was maybe in 1/3 of the omelette? so it was mostly an omelette with no cheese. Home fries were just potatoes and grease, no seasoning, herbs, onions, or anything else to give it flavor.
author: P K.

description: My husband, mother in-law and I love coming here :) we enjoy their service. Very friendly ^_^!!!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Good place to eat breakfast. Plays a great music station. Good service, yummy French toast, and eggs and sausage. All hot and fresh.
author: claire D.

description:
My boyfriend and I come here every other month for breakfast.  The blueberry pancakes are divine and the traditional Irish breakfast is awesome.  Wait staff is friendly and attentive.  Coffee this time was very good although it's hit and miss as it was burnt the last time we came here.  Still not bad enough to keep us away.

This place actually does have a flat screen TV although I found it completely unnecessary since no one was paying attention to the football game.  We come here to eat breakfast and chat! Why is it on? The volume, however, was turned down low enough not to hear crunching or whistles.  Still, it detracts from the ambiance and all the beautiful artwork and SF photography hung up on the walls.

We will always come back for the black and white pudding.
author: Patricia P.

description:
This is a great place to go for breakfast or brunch on weekends.  It is hardly ever busy while every other place in the West Portal is packed.

The staff  is always friendly and the food comes out fast.  I also like coming here for lunch on weekdays because it's a nice spot to sit and read while you eat.

The menu is pretty diverse for a diner.  I haven't had a meal here yet that blew my socks off, but it is reliably good.
author: Terra D.

description: So my family and I just tried to have lunch here and the waitress basically yold us, "Sorry, we cant seat all nine of you together. You'll have to sit separately." She threw down some menus and walked away. Rude! The food is not even that great there and you have bad service on top off it. Never coming back here even though my family lives a block away.
author: Tracy Q.

description: Waiting for Village Grill next door which is always packed is worth it. This place is lousy.
author: Chris S.

description:
Dammit, I wish I could've seen yelp reviews before I came here.
I love burritos. LOVE. There was a major problem I had with this place: their meat tastes like it came from a can. Whatever this crap is, it wasn't fresh. The cook was hanging around by the counter, and it took him 2-3 minutes to even make my food. 
I can honestly say that this is the worst burrito I've ever had in my life. The meat just disgusted me the whole time. Some tortilla chips tasted stale, the salsa lacked a spicy kick. I'm just glad they didn't mess up the rice and beans. 
Got the Mission Impossible $7.50 + tax = $8.14

Never again.
author: Cathy N.

description: My cousin wanted to eat here, and it was good. The service was pretty slow, i think there was only one waitress. The food took forever and they got my order wrong. But the food was still good. I would come back just because it wasn't as packed as other places. But it's not my first choice.
author: Irma R.

description: Toast restaurant nearby had a 20 minute wait so we decided to come here where there were only a few people. (Can't reason with a hungry man and toddler, ugh!) We sat down, and it would be nice if a server came up to our table in less than 2 minutes to at least get us drinks (we like to drink coffee while we figure out what to eat) but I know that doesn't happen sometimes. But another couple walked in and sat down next to us and one server walked right past our table to this couple and took their order(really?)..we were patient and just waited. That same server walked past us with the other couple's drinks and as she was walking by, we tell her that we have been waiting and were there before this couple she is now serving and she says in broken english, "they will come take your order"...umm ok. So we wait a little more and ANOTHER female server is walking toward this same couple to ask if they're ready to order and the man tells her they have already ordered and she just says OK and walks back WITHOUT even acknowledging my table to at least say "I will be right with you"..I was so irritated with the lack of customer service that I lost my appetite and did not want to order. If it were just me, I would have gotten up and went back to TOAST but when a man is hungry, he doesn't care about whats going on and just wants his food smh. He was paying anyway so whatever lol..I decided to go to Starbucks and grab my coffee before I say something not so nice to those servers. Maybe that other couple are regulars but that doesn't excuse their lack of customer service. Learn to ACKNOWLEDGE the customers who are coming to spend their money in your restaurant that smells funny and serves mediocre food! Of course we won't be back.
author: Lilian L.

description:
Cheap.

This place looks and tastes like to save on supplies they cut corners.

The meat in my turkey sandwich could easily have come out of some package you'd buy at a convince store and the orange juice was the sort you'd get out of a tube. The dried out romaine lettuce and the horrible tasting, completely white french fries were just the cherry on top.

Think of an "old lady who shops at the bargain bin" making you lunch.

I wish I'd read the reviews first. Ugh and never again.
author: Meg T.

description:
It's not that this place is bad that gives it 2 stars, but this place isn't good either. I could very easily make all this at home. And everything tasted so....store-bought and bland. However, the waitress was super nice. :)

eh, I was very unimpressed. 

I'm sticking to Irving Street Cafe when I crave breakfast food.
author: Wanda M.

description: Stopped in for a quick lunch on a Sunday. Really great service, the waitress was really friendly and quick. I ordered 2 poached eggs and ham. Nothing fancy but it's what I wanted and it came out quick and fresh. Great price, great service. A lot of their menu items are listed on the wall as "specials" so it's a good idea to look beyond the menu when deciding.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
This is the quintessentially second choice restaurant. Whenever I don't want to wait for a table at the Village Grill or Squat and Gobble I come here. Servers are generally friendly and try their best, even though I need to remind them that I asked for coffee and a new fork and she just brought me coffee. Food is generally passable, meaning that I was too lazy to buy and make the omelet that I just ordered but I could definitely do it better at home. 

All three stars for the fact that I never have to wait for a table, which come to think of it, might not be a good thing.
author: Dom L.

description:
On most things, I agree with the other reviewers that Rain Tree is not anything to write home about. I've come here since I was a kid, and the decor, speed of service, and menu have not changed once in those near thirty years. 

But. BUT! Tonight I went for an easy, cheap dinner, and ended up having the best burger I can remember. I was floored! I ordered with bacon, avocado, and jack cheese, and every part of it was perfect- the burger had that delicious charbroiled taste and was done just right, that smoky savory flavor on the outside, but still tender and wonderful on the inside- the cheese was perfectly gooey, the avocados light, fresh and delicious. The french fries were crispy golden and perfect. The chocolate milkshake I had with it (because why not!) was thick, and clearly made with real ice cream and milk, none of that chocolate syrup BS, served in a old-timey malt-shop glass, lovingly topped with whipped cream and a little chocolate powder.

I am a girl that really likes her burgers. I frequent Burgermeister often, and I have Godfather's from San Carlos whenever I can. But still, whether it's by fluke or by finding an undiscovered SF treasure, this burger was my favorite by far. Try them out and hopefully you are as surprised and delighted as I was.
author: Andrea W.

description:
Going to give this place a 5 star, although I would say it is a solid 4, or 4.5. That is only because I think it the baffling 1 or 2 starts lingering about need to be balanced out.

We came here multiple times on our short trip to San Fran. During our visit we also hit a number of tourist trap, and some food hot spots with good reviews, but again and again we found that the value we got was at this place topped them all. Most of the meals are less than $8, a rare thing for San Fran. The service was fast and friendly, and the taste was yummy.

Next time we are in town, will definitely come back here.
author: Sam H.

description: I ordered Eggs Benedict for breakfast.  The English muffin was raw.  They said they grill the muffin instead of toast.  The muffin was barely browned and it was chewy.  The poached egg was so under-cooked it ran all over the plate.  The rim and cap of the ketchup bottle was BLACK.  Disgusting.  I showed it to the waitress, she brings me another ketchup bottle (after putting the black one back on the counter next to the other bottles) and the rim and the cap was BLACK.  That is my last meal at Rain Tree.  Gross.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Adequate. I'd've given it three stars but for two things: the weird policy where they don't let you pay with a credit card unless it's over ten dollars. (The first time I ate there, I did not know this and hadn't got any cash on me, so I was forced to order a hot chocolate in order to be able to pay for my food. Thanks, Rain Tree.)

Then too, the food is.....well, it's okay, but as The Husband pointed out, he could do just as well in the kitchen. Maybe even a little better. I get that we're coming for convenience as well as taste and flavor, but surely you can provide something a little more taste-worthy than what I can cook in my kitchen in ten minutes.

Oh, and the chips we were served with The Husband's breakfast burrito were stale and over-salty. Whee.

The next time we get a breakfast urge, we're just gonna hop on the train and get off at Castro for Orphan Andy's: tasty and fun! Sorry, Rain Tree, we gave you two chances and you just didn't do it for us.
author: Lis M.

description: I don't know why the reviews aren't better. My bf and I liked what we ordered. I got eggs florentine and he had a shrimp omelette. And they were open on Christmas.
author: Denise M.

description:
Waring to anyone who wants to be served edible food and receive adequate service... DO NOT GO HERE!

Wow, where do I even begin. Instead of a rant I'll just break it down.

-Service was quite possibly the worst that I have experienced in all of my adventures in SF. Seriously. She was absolutely brain dead, only a few other customers were in at the time, and she just couldn't get it together. My thimble of a coffee cup was empty after two sips and there was never any attempt, or even thought of refilling it. She never checked back on our table despite my attempts at getting her attention without being rude. Worst service ever. 

-Food also ranked as one of the worst meals that I have ever been served. I ordered the California Chicken Sandwich, (avocado, jack cheese, bacon, and chicken severed on a bun with fries) Upon first glance, it didn't look too bad, upon first bite however, that all changed. I literally could not bite through the chicken. The work rubbery doesn't do justice to how inedible and disgusting this sandwich was. I couldn't even attempt to eat it. My attempts at alerting my waitress of my issue went unnoticed until my bf had finished eating and I was in a bad mood. (bf's omelet was not good either) Sandwich was removed from our bill, but it was a little too late to make up for how bad everything was. 

Apparently you can't give zero stars, so one was my only option.
author: Nolan W.

description:
I was looking for a good diner for brunch, and West Portal seemed like the kind of neighborhood where I'd find such a place.  Unfortunately, an old-school diner I'd been to about a year ago on this block, has changed hands and is now part of a chain.  I wound up going here because it looked the part, and there was no wait to get in at 11am on a rather brisk Sunday when I wasn't keen on waiting outdoors.  

First, the coffee.  I was't expecting much, but the coffee was definitely burned.  It's a good thing I also asked for water, because I barely managed to make it through one cup of coffee, despite the temptation of free refills.  

For food, I ordered two eggs over medium, with sausage, home fries, and whole wheat toast.  It came out reasonably quickly.  First, I tried the home fries.  They were nothing but completely unseasoned small red potatoes.  No salt, no pepper, no onions, no bell peppers, no garlic, or anything else that typically makes home fries great.  Just unseasoned potatoes straight off the flat grill.  The eggs were cooked just as ordered, but were also pretty flavorless.  The sausage was the only part of the meal that lived up to expectations.  The whole wheat toast tasted more closely resembled a mild sourdough that just happened to be brown.   If I had one word to characterize the meal, it would be "bland."  My only saving grace was that the table setting included salt, pepper, and Tapatio.  Perhaps this place is catering to the low-sodium crowd, but the majority of people dining here will likely find it necessary to doctor their meals.
author: Miles B.

description: Portions are pretty skimpy, French toast was extremely underwhelming, on the verge of bad. My husbands pancakes looked pretty good. Waitress was nice and they have coca cola and refills so that alone gives them at least 4 stars but then i took some away for the poor french toast and small portions.
author: Emma H.

description: My husband's Egg Blackstone came with a cold slices of Cheddar on top of poached eggs and grilled tomatoes.  He asked if the cheese always came uncooked. Yes they said. We concluded it was a risky selection on their menu.
author: Priscilla O.

description: Ordering a BLT with potato salad is pitching a pretty slow ball right across the plate. This place just doesn't offer me a reason to go back. It's not really competing in the "restaurant" catergoy in SF. If this were Suisun, and the meal was $6, and I was personally connected to the owners  ...maybe...but here in SF I can even do better for $6.
author: Luke M.

description:
Got a super burrito, which was the special of the day, came with a free drink for 6.95.  Pretty good deal, but the burrito was pretty bland, salsa and chips tasted alright though.

Only go here if there is nothing else around, it isn't BAD by any stretch of the imagination, it is just kinda generic.

I hear their breakfast is good though.
author: Ryan D.

description: Went here for breakfast on my daughters birthday. We were waited on right away and the server was very polite and friendly. The food came fairly quickly and was hot and tasted great. I had the Cajun sausage and eggs, and it was very good. I would recommend this place to everyone.
author: Joe G.

description:
We decided to have lunch at this spot.

The menu has a few good items to choice from.
the space is medium and not cramped.
It did not seem to bright, but maybe the folks in there like that.
It can be busy, but not super busy. 
We waited a bit longer for our food as there was only 1 person as the cashier and waiteress. 
She was very friendly and didnt have a problem multitasking.
The price was not bad as it matched the portion.
The food was not that bad either.

parking is on the street and metered. I asked for change from the cashier and she had no problem doing that.
author: Roger A.

description: Breakfast here wasn't good.  Had corned beef hash & eggs.  Eggs were runny, potatoes were soggy and the coffee wasn't fresh.  The toast was ok.  There are now the only traditional diner on the street.  Too bad.  Won't be coming back.  It's time for something better; people want quality food, not tired and poorly prepared slop.
author: Debbie W.

description: Came in for Sunday breakfast and ordered pancakes, California omelet and coffee.  Nothing special with middle of the pack prices.  Service was extremely slow, but I think that was due to staff shortage.  Place seemed to have regulars, so I guess that's good.  I guess this is okay if you're in the neighborhood and wanting cheap eats
author: Joel M.

description:
Since writing my original review below, I had a bad return experience.  Lidiya was not working at the time.  My daughter found a hair in her French Toast.  When I got my French Toast and two scrambled eggs, it looked like about one egg.  When I mentioned this to the waitress, she said maybe I was used to larger eggs.  (Huh?)  I could order additional eggs if I wanted to.  Not exactly what I was expecting.  They did comp my daughter's French Toast, but after this experience, I don't think I will be going back for a while.

"This café is just what you want when you are looking for a good solid breakfast in your neighborhood.  You don't get a lot frills, but you aren't paying for them either.  Lidiya is courteous and efficient.  I am not sure why the last few reviews dinged the place.  The floors were clean, the food hot and the service prompt.  What more do you want?"
author: Ryan J.

description:
Um, I stopped by here only because my friend lived nearby and we really really really had to go put in 18 holes before the drizzle of the oncoming evening would affect my swing and vision.

I ordered the brunch plate, and have to say, although the scrambled eggs were a bit runny and dry at the same time, my bacon was perfect.  Salty, crispy, crunchy fat sticks of satisfaction.  As I munched away, my friend ate his omelet in one swoop, despite the fact that it had cheese when he ordered one with no cheese.

Service was decent, quick even.  By the time we got up and left, the waitress was clearing off the table before we hit the door.

Not a bad place for locals to walk to for a quick bite.
author: Miika M.

description: Friendly service, traditional breakfast menu, fair prices.  Food tastes fine, nothing special--but us San Franciscans are spoiled.
author: Florlina A.

description:
Greasy food, mediocre service.

Place to go when recovering from the night before.
author: Vanessa W.

description: Quite possibly the worst dining experience we've ever had. Wow. My mind is still blown. I write this review while my boyfriend is getting a slice of pizza. He was still hungry because the pancakes he ordered were rubbery disks that did not cut easily. Half way through the meal we told the waitress about the pancakes. She mumbled something like, "Let me check..." And never came back. We waited patiently for new pancakes that never came. When we eventually asked she snidely said, You never said anything so..."  The bacon was chewy and the potatoes were burned and flavorless. We were not greeted when we sat down. The waitress brought the OJ and spilled some on the table, then walked away without acknowledging the mess. She brought my plate with a gooey substance on the bottom that slapped down on the table. The food was bad and the service was horrible. It was unclear what she planned to do about the pancakes so I went up to her and. said, "how about if you just take those off the bill and we'll go. This has already been such a bad experience and your attitude isn't helping either. So thank you for that." She responded with, "Oh you're welcome."
author: Patricia T.

description:
Food = mediocre, at best

Service = crapola diner, perhaps worse, and staff is high turnover rate

I don't go here unless everything else is too busy, or I'm too hungry to bother going to another part of the city for a meal.  

I haven't eaten here in over 4 years though.  And from what I am reading, I am not missing much.
author: Fannie S.

description: I ordered the banana pancakes and thought they were very tasty.  The waitress was nice, and she got my food to me in less than ten minutes.  Honestly, I don't see why the reviews for this place are so low.  If you're like me and you're pressed for time in the mornings yet still want to eat out for breakfast on the weekdays before school starts, this place is quick and cheap.
author: Shelby M.

description:
Great service. Good prices. Average food. 
I had Eggs Benedict. Not bad-but not great.
Coffee was delicious!
author: J C.

description: My husband ordered coffee, it was cold, after he told the wait staff, the coffee was taken away to be microwaved. We are not coming back.
author: SJ L.

description: I don't usually give two stars but this place is a no go. I don't remember it being that bad... I guess as you get older, you know real food. came here for brunch on a Sunday... surprisingly, there were only about 5 occupied tables. service was still poor. food... I ordered the salmon scramble. bland, bland, bland. as were the home fries. I guess the only decent thing was my whole wheat toast and water. blet. the bf ordered corned beef hash. not appetizing... way to much bell peppers. who adds that in corned beef hash?! will NOT be returning.
author: Ann T.

description: Well, my wife and I would probably write different reviews but I'll just give you mine.  I had the basic burger and it was just fine.  Cooked correctly and reasonably priced, with fries that were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The onion rings were also very good.  You have to be okay with tap water unless you want to buy a drink but that is probably true of 90% of all places in the City.  Anyway, the place was empty when we got there (6:00pm on a Tues) and empty when we left which is not a good sign.  My family didn't feel great after but didn't get sick either.  I might go back as it is in the neighborhood and isn't crowed but I doubt I can get them to come with me.
author: Michael B.

description:
It didn't help that I was extremely hungry when I came here. 

I looked in the window and saw the fish and chips special and decided to try it out. 

I took the food to go. When I got back to my place I opened the container and was surprised at the coleslaw, and thought cool they even added potato salad. NOPE! That was tartar sauce.. wtf? why not in a seperate container not next to my coleslaw (yuck) and on my fries (even more yuck). Fries that were, btw, not crunchy and more in between limp and soggy but warm. The fish was actually fried well and still juicy inside, so I have to give them that. 

If I was starving again, I might try a burger next time. But I will def know now not to look at potato salad with my fish and chips :/
author: Eric A.

description:
There's definitely a reason why we were able to grab a table here on a Saturday morning, while Squat & Gobble and Village Grill nearby had lines out the door. We saw the bad reviews on Yelp, but we thought "Meh we're hungry, how bad can it be?"

My friend and I shared the bacon & avocado omelet and blueberry pancakes. The omelet was dry and the pancakes were doughy (not fluffy), which, you know, whatever, sometimes I over-mix the batter too, but WHY WERE THE PANCAKES ACTUALLY BLUE. Like blue raspberry Jolly Rancher blue. Anyone who has made blueberry pancakes or blueberry smoothies or eaten a blueberry knows that the juice is more like a Barney-purple, not actually BLUE, and the whole pancake does not turn cotton candy BLUE.

I'm not a picky eater. I wanted cheap diner food. But I came here starving and actually left dissatisfied. And kinda pissed at myself. Patience is a virtue, wait in line elsewhere next time. $22 with coffee +tip.
author: Leah C.

description:
Wow, we should have looked this place up on Yelp before we committed to eating here on a recent Sunday night. We should have also known when walking upon here how empty it was on a night where people should be enjoying a hot meal in the city. However, we were a bit pressed for time and had to get a quick bite for our daughter before she had to get ready for bed at a nearby inn we were staying at. The restaurant gods sure did punish us by allowing us to experience this excuse for a restaurant.

If you're coming to West Portal primarily for this establishment, that's pretty sad knowing that you'll have to pay for metered parking as well ($2/hr). The food here is halfway decent if you're hungry, which is a combination of Mexican and American dishes. If you have leftovers, don't bother asking for a container or bag. We didn't end up eating ours since it was utterly gross the day after, which speaks volumes about the ingredients. Breakfast is served all day. I ordered a basic cheeseburger. It was good, but nothing spectacular. I mean, you can't really mess up a hamburger, can you? The fries could have been crispier too. My wife ordered a soup and sandwich combo. However, she wanted a steak sandwich for her combo. The waitress didn't allow her sandwich selection even though it flatly states on the menu that ANY sandwich can be selected for the combo! She only ended up eating half her soup. My daughter had a quesadilla and it was pretty disgusting. The cheese was just mozzarella. I felt they took a mozzarella stick and used a microwave to melt it. The good ones I've tasted and enjoyed use a combination of different cheeses. On top of this travesty of a dish, the tortilla chips that were served were stale and tasted like something that came out of a bag produced in the 90's. Needless to say, my daughter went to bed hungry that night.

In regards to the ambiance and amenities, I was aghast at how poorly the place is maintained. I give this place a month or two before the city shuts it down for nastiness. The tables were sticky and the place smelled like deep fried oil. The bathroom (unisex) was even nastier. The floor was saturated with urine and there was no toilet paper. I understand the place is going to close within the hour, but there are still customers inside the establishment. Even 20 minutes before closing, the waitress closed the restaurant. She probably did someone a huge favor.
author: Andy P.

description:
Went here for breakfast with my family to meet a cousin who I hadn't seen in about five years. I've always passed by this place and never really gave it any mind.  It's small and the menu reflects that as well.  The portion sizes were ok, though I'm use to those hefty American sized breakfast.  There was only one waitress in the whole restaurant, which did get crowded, so I had to asked for refills of coffee and iced tea, which wasn't a huge deal since she got it to be fairly quickly.  I wish they had hash-browns but instead they had home fries, which were really just pan fried chunks of potatoes, but nothing a little salt, pepper and ketchup can't fix.

Friendly staff, just needs a larger menu.
author: Brian J.

description:
Average place.
Average food.
Average service.

Although when I came here for a 3pm breakfast, I found certain things quite amusing: the random as hell wallart, the setting, the fact that every single table had cream for coffee even if the place was deserted.. and the girl apologizing for not having change for a $100 bill. So two stars, plus a bonus one for entertainment value.
author: Jade T.

description: Very meh. Food was average, maybe even below average, but the staff was friendly enough.
author: Madeline P.

description:
*Gasp*

Made a choice to come here and when browsing the menu I had seen a list of burgers. I forgot the one I got(sorry),but probably it was just a plain jane with cheese because that is what it tasted like. I mean it had a little flavor and wasn't bad,but it could had a few more kicks in it.

The place is in a good location : West Portal 

Inside: I thought was clean enough and a decent size. It seems to me maybe this is more of a breakfast joint maybe. The service was friendly,it's just the burger was alright. The fries,well they were ok,nothing thick like Barney's.

Prices reasonable

They even have decent sized counter you can sit and eat at.
author: Dani D.

description:
I've eaten here a few times and I've never had a meal that really impressed me.  I went there with my boyfriend a couple weekends ago and both of our meals were either over or under cooked and a little bland. The only thing we liked was the corned beef hash, which we only ordered because we were still hungry since we couldn't finish our meals.
The only real up side is that the service was OK.
author: Doozer H.

description: Not that great. Ordered the Chorizo Scramble. The rice was not fresh, the refried beans were bland and tasted like it was out of a can. The service mediocre and was not attentive. Maybe next time, I'll try the breakfast special of pancakes or french toast. Just get something simple: eggs, meat, and toast.
author: Allen C.

description:
Sometimes you just want a basic breakfast with no line, and maybe you want that breakfast at 3:00pm.  Sometimes you want to talk to people, or maybe you just want to sit quietly with the paper.

For these times, you go to Raintree.  They serve the standard egg dishes, as well as burgers, sandwiches and burritos.  I have had the eggs benedict a few times, and it's good.  Today I had an omlette with ham, green onions, mushrooms and cheese and it was good, too.  

The veggie patty melt is really good.

Although it is not on the menu, they do offer a Traditional Irish breakfast, blood pudding and all.  It's written on a sign on the back wall of the restaurant, under the "View of SF from Alcatraz" painting.

Service is quick and pretty friendly. Decor is quirky and no-frills at the same time.  

If you live in vicinity of West Portal, it is one of the few places to get a standard breakfast on Sunday morning (or afternoon) so I am glad to have Raintree in the neighborhood. 

Counter in the back for solo diners.
author: Liz S.

description:
My husband and I come here from time to time.  Today was one of those times.  It's an OK place.  We come here once every 4-5 months I think, when we don't want to go to any of the other places and we can't think straight.

I usually get their bacon, avocado, swiss cheese burger with fries for $7.95, and my husband gets the fish and chips for $7.95.

If you can get out of an "American-style" food place without paying more than $20 for two people, it's cheap.
author: Priscilla L.

description: A friend and eat here about every other Saturday, the food is OK but they need to learn to accept that if you serve something bad you fix it.  One time the orange juice was fresh squeezed but they must have gotten a bad one cause it tasted sour.  Four others complained as well but the waitress coment was that "it was fresh squeezed this morning"  OK so fix it dont tell your customers they are wrong.  Another meal had a ham slice that was half raw, they did fix it but should have gotten it right the first time.  While the food is usually good, they dont like it if you complain that something is not done right and their potatoes are never cooked all the way through.  That said, they have good coffee and eggs done to perfection.  If it wasnt for the eggs they would get only two stars.
author: Raquel S.

description:
Standard breakfast/ brunch type food.

You can go to one of the many other breakfast type restaurants at West Portal.  I usually see only one waitress working on a busy Sunday morning, so you're not going to get any decent attention.

Raintree serves the regular fair.  Sausage, bacon and eggs, burgers and fries, omeletes, etc...
author: Sam T.

description:
I don't particularly like this place because of the menu.  Just not what I look for in a brunch spot.  But my family likes it, so when I go here, I order the waffle.  Just plain, because they don't have fruit.  What?  No fruit?  What's up with that??  I was tempted to run down the block to the market and pick up some fruit myself.

So I'm grumpy every time we go here, but I have to admit, the service is good.  Nice staff.
author: spiff e.

description:
I just reread my review for dinner, where I wasn't too impressed with the eats and was hoping breakfast would be better. Not so much.

I mean, it was fine, fine in a way that almost anything tastes good after a night of dancing. Took longer than most places, and it was a heap of food, but I have a problem when the surcharges almost cost as much as my meal. A dollar for egg whites. Another dollar for chicken apple sausage (as opposed to regular). At this point, the breakfast "special" didn't quite seem so special anymore.
author: Jason B.

description:
I cam across this place upon a recommendation from my sister.  With a huge craving for corned beef hash, my mouth was drooling when my order arrived.  The service was great with very friendly staff.  Because my sister and I were the only customers, I'm glad that they completed our order in a quick and timely fashion.
This place serves better as a breakfast diner as their menu is limited to mainly sandwiches and burgers for lunch and dinner.
As for the corned beef, I think it tasted pretty good although they are very light on the beef.  I believe it was a little overcooked and over-salted, but I didn't care at that time.  I would also like to add that  their portions are significantly small; I believe that I barely got full from the meal.  I would have considered giving this place 4 stars if they had provided a bigger portion on all their menu items.
I don't see myself going there again just primarily because the amount of food you get is certainly not worth the price.
author: Vinson T.

description:
They suck! They suck they suck they suck they suck! The last time I was there was with my sister and we ordered breakfast. We waited forever and finally we asked the waitress (who was busy chatting with a friend) what happened to our order and she went to check and came back to say that she forgot to put it in. WHAT?? BULLSHIT! It wasn't even busy in there! What kind of fucked up waitress is she? That was two years ago and I have boycotted that place ever since. DON'T GO!

EDIT 9/12/07: Ok, I went back. They changed the waitstaff so it's not twenty-something girls who act all holier than thou. They're nice and are prompt this time. So much better! I had the chorizo scramble which was pretty slamin' as it came with rice and beans (both a tad on the bland side) and tortillas. OH! AND Tapatio on the table! Not the best place for breakfast in the Portal, but there's no need for a boycott anymore.
author: Jackie I.

description:
parking is difficult but you can find some down the street.

this place is expensive and the food takes a long time.  I don't know how this place is related to the other Cafe Rain Tree, because the other one tastes so good and the service is great.  

this one is ALWAYS kind of empty and it still takes a long time and it doesn't even taste fresh.

Why not 1 star?  I dunno, i feel kind of bad about giving them 1 star...but i don't think i'll be eating here anymore.
author: Bing D.

description:
I would have to say that this place disappoints me in so many ways. Since I live close to this place I use to come here a lot when I was younger but now I can't stand even thinking bout this place. I've been here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner before and I can tell you to avoid this place at all costs. The atmosphere sucks since there's never really anyone in here in the first place, the servers seems to rush you to finish eating, and the unbearable wait times are really annoying.

The food itself is quite bad. I ordered a simple meal of eggs, bacon, and toast and I can tell you that the eggs were soggy and undercooked, the bacon were rubbery and tasteless, and the toast felt like it was stale to say the least. Add to the fact that the place is extremely overpriced and you can see why so many people gave bad reviews of the place. I would say if there is any reason you would come here, go during lunch cuz the only thing they do here right is the burgers. Don't waste your time coming here for dinner either trust me. Last time I came here I ordered the burrito combo and that was one of the worst experiences in my life. I thought this place would be at least semi decent but it's not. Avoid this place at all costs if you have the chance.

I would normally be more willing to give a better score, but I just can't shake the negative vibe here. Maybe they changed owners recently or cut back on service and produce, who knows? All I can say is that there are many other places you can go to and feel good about it at the same time.
author: Jason Y.

description:
This is an average cafe with an unusual menu.  Unusual meaning you don't normally see a cafe menu bringing burritos and burgers together outside of a TGIF's/Chili's or a high school cafeteria.  BTW... I think this place used to be called Godzilla cafe at one point. 

Anyway, my wife and I stumbled in here after a long meeting with some teachers at CSS.   The first thing that caught my eye on the menu was that they served Monte Cristos.  For those unfamiliar, a Monte Cristo sandwich consists of ham, turkey, and Swiss cheese between two slices of bread, soaked in an egg-based batter and grilled or deep-fried.  I remember a thread where a certain Yelper had the jones for it and I just had to try one.    

It was OK.  It was grilled, not deep fried.  Kinda sloppy actually.  I had high expectations, maybe too high because it didn't really live up to it's hype.  I had some serious heartburn afterwards.  I'm sure if it was deep fried, it would've tasted better and the heartburn would've been worth it.  My wife's avocado BLT was great though.  Nice side, very greeny side salad with a great vinegrette. I'm sure the burgers are decent as well because they smelled great coming from the next table over.
author: Larry A.

description:
I went here back in 2001 with my ex and it was cool. Nothing to rave about nor would I make an effort to come back here. Ordered pancakes that were the size of 10" in diameter. Decent pricing.

Came back here in 2008 when they had a $5 lunch burger w/fries meal deal. Never went back after they stopped doing that deal.

 My only complaint is that a few times the meat was pinkish in the middle.

3 stars.
author: Keit K.

description:
Update: It's official, this has become my local spot to eat my meals....i am there sometimes 2 times week. 

Update: I just had the Joes Special...Very Good and Totally Filling! 


ok, so i read all the reviews to see what others experiences were like at this place. I have since been there on two occassions this past week and this is my take. 

for starters, this is definitely a local spot that is not too be compared to the GREATEST PLACE ever, but for the price you can't go wrong. I have only had the Blueberry Pancakes on both occassions and they are DA BOMB!!! My roomie had the omelette with mixed veggies and she was happy with the outcome, (she did however get the wrong toast, but if you are going to die over getting the wrong toast, you should really just stay home and cook for yourself)...Our friend had the French Toast and she gave it a two thumbs up!!! So now you know at least the Blueberry Pancakes, the Scrambled Veggie and the Frenchie Toastie are all a good buy!!! 

I am going back to try their burger, because sometimes one just needs a greasy burger to indulge in!!! I will let you all know what i think about the burger when i try it...

Lastly, the service was great on both occassions. Jenna and the gal on my first visit, (Damn forgot her name) were both super friendly and really down to earth...But remember people, don't come in here trying to find the worlds best cafe b/c you may be expecting too much, but certainly give it a shot when you are looking for place to run in and run out quick with a nice full tummy!!!

Life is not about stressing about the little things, it's about just being honest and chillin with what comes your way...
author: Ivan E.

description:
Was in the area for work and need a bite to eat for Lunch/Dinner one Saturday afternoon.  Decided to stop off at the Raintree Cafe because it looked to be a bit different than the other options here.

Raintree Cafe, is that a cafe.  Most of the options here are the simple soup and sandwich variety.  But they do offer more gourmet options such as crepes, organic salads, and interesting omelette's.  Prices here are "reasonable" for Mill Valley.  You're probably looking between the $8 - $12 range for most items on the menu.

Looking over the menu I decided to go with the Monte Crisp Sandwich and a Coke.  It's kind of weird here as they have both a wait service and a counter to order food from.  The sandwich took about 10 - 15 minutes.  When it came out, it had a pretty good portion size.  Taste wise, it was pretty good.  Not too greasy with the cheese nicely melted.  I added some of the hot sauce they had on the table to give it a bit more flavor to it.  I have to admit, it was a bit bland and just needed the extra "oomph".  The service here was good.  They waiter was really friendly and nice.

Overall, I think I spent about $13 including tip.  Overall, I'm thinking just average.  It wouldn't be high on my recommendation list, but I would definitely came back if I was in the area.  Overall 3 Stars and Raintree Cafe is decent option for your simple cafe needs.
author: Chris C.

description:
My experience here wasn't as bad as those of previous posters...

Their breakfast specials are good and cheap...

The girl who took my order/worked the register should have been in school, though.  It was a Thursday morning. She looked like she belonged in homeroom...
author: Nathan W.

description:
looks enticing from the exterior, but doesn't deliver in food quality.

irish breakfast was average and unremarkable.

service was slow enough to be noticed.
author: Joseph C.

description:
Went here on a whim one day after driving past looking for lunch on a Sunday. The restaurant wasn't busy so a friend and I decided to give it a try. The menu was standard cafe/diner affair with breakfast and sandwich items so I decided to test their patty melt.

What came was a delightful surprise! Wonderful marbled rye bread with a hefty beef patty with grilled onions and cheese=mmmmmm. I remember being quite full from the half of the sandwich but stuffing myself so I would not have to tote the onion-containing sandwich in my car.

I'd definitely eat there again, the table could have been cleaner and we did wait a while for service but the food is what makes the place worth it.
author: Alden C.

description:
I was in the neighborhood and wanted breakfast.  Art's Cafe and others had long lines so I thought I would try Raintree Cafe, which had no wait.

Why the two stars?  Well on the positive (or rather, the "non-negative") side of things,  the food was OK.  I ordered eggs, sausage, toast and home fries, and while it was not anything to write home about, it wasn't bad.   

On the negative side of things, I think their operations and staffing are a bit of a mess.  I sat at the counter so had front row seats to see how they operate.  Some things I saw and heard

 1. The cook appeared to be a bit behind the eight ball, very busy and many tickets to fill, yet when he did fill orders they were left to stand for quite some time (getting cold), waiting for waitresses to finish the order (add toast, add powdered sugar on top of French toast, etc). They didn't seem to have their act together.  
 2. Waitresses making toast and then arguing over which order the toast was for.  Accusing each other of "stealing my toast".  
 3. Lot of rushing around, maybe because they were a bit understaffed?  I wanted a coffee refill and had some trouble getting the waitresses attention and when I did, they hurriedly filled my cup with the decaf pot that was in their hand, rather than asking what kind of coffee I was drinking (it wasn't decaf)
 4. Finally, the guy next to me ordered hash browns and when the order came they gave him home fries.  When he pointed out that he ordered hash browns the waitress said, "this is the only kind of potatoes we have".  He then said why didn't you tell me that when I ordered and the waitress said, "this is what we call hash browns."  Come on, now.  

Now to be fair, none of these items by themselves is a huge deal, but taken together (and I saw all these things in the space of about 20 minutes)  I get the feeling that this place is not that well run, and so next time I'm in the neighborhood and want breakfast I'll probably wait in line at Art's Cafe.
author: XiuCe H.

description:
