Hmmm...how do I say this...DO NOT EVER EAT HERE! First time I went with some friends I was studying with at Starbucks (a few doors up) and I ordered their special burrito. It was delicious! A few hours later, I started to have abdominal cramping and got very nauseated and I threw up a few times. I wasn't sure why I felt so sick, but I couldn't blame it on the burrito because I had eaten out the same day prior to my visit. One of my friends had the same exact symptoms as I had.

2nd visit: I decided to go back to the place because i was really hungry and they are cheap. Literally, within 2 hours, the same episodes of abdominal cramping and vomiting took place. I was sure it was the burrito, which I had ordered again, because it was the only thing I had to eat all day. 

I also noticed that the employees will handle the bill/cash and go make the food without washing their hands. If it was up to me, I'd close the place down for good!  I should have realized that both times I went, there were only a few customers. It makes sense now. 

This isn't the first time I've had Mexican food, so it's not like I am unable to tolerate it.  

I can only confirm all the negative reviews posted for this place. If you really feel like vomiting and suffering, I suggest you go to this place.

If I was dying of starvation, with no money, and this was the only place open offering free food, I still would NOT go here. STAY AWAY!!! This place should be closed down!
author: mah o.

description:
While they offered a great burger - the Royal Burger (a well cooked burger with a fried egg on top), it was what I told my friends, "sub-par."  I love burgers and consider myself quite the connoisseur, and I can tell you that a burger lover will be a bit disappointed by these.

They were quite accommodating, allowing my friend to sample the hollandaise sauce, in the off chance she may come back and order the eggs Florentine.  Furthermore, the price was great - a good amount of food for a reasonable price.

All in all, it all leveled out into a rather standard meal.  If you want classic diner food, then Cafe Rain Tree is really the only place to go if you are in this neck of the city.  However, I would recommend S & G or El Toreador over this one.
author: Michael T.

description:
Ok, but nothing sensational.

Service was friendly but slow.  Our sodas came in cups with dirty stuff in them.  So the waitress got us new sodas.  Food took awhile and wasn't anything to praise but nothing to put down either.  

The BF's burrito was huge but falling apart and lacking in flavor.  He ate the whole thing though so it wasn't horrible or that bad.  My burger was dry, and nothing sensational but nothing to rave about.  It was a swiss burger though with cheese and mushrooms so I was still able to eat the whole thing.  

It wasn't too crowded and was the only place without a line around the block (ie. Cafe for All Seasons and the Village Grill).  Maybe we should have taken that as a hint.  

Oh well.  I don't have bad memories of the place and I didn't have the worse experience here today.  If I was starving and everything else was closed in West Portal I could eat here and live.  I just don't expect to wake up and think, "Oh I really am craving something from Raintree Cafe."
author: Denise B.

description:
On the weekend this place is packed with people waiting to get in.  So, I decided to give this place a try.  I headed in late afternoon and ordered a Raintree special - blueberry pancakes, with 2 eggs, and choice of sausage or bacon.  I asked for runny scrabbled eggs which was decent, the pancakes tasted a bit burnt, and the sausages were ok.

This place just doesn't do it for me.  The food was unimpressive and honestly a bit boring.
author: Twist' D.

description: I go here at least once a week. I've been pretty happy. Service is nice. They come straight to my table with the drink that I like. I usually order the tuna salad sandwich, burger or breakfast. Burrito is too spicy for me. I wish they would add thousand island to their dressings. They should also fix their door. It can be hard at times to get in!
author: Jessica M.

description:
My girlfriend and I wanted to have a late brunch, but without the traveling time to Stack's at Burlingame, so we decided to drop by West Portal to try something else. We thought about heading to Village Grill. Instead, we had brunch at Cafe Rain Tree. 

Fairly clean and simple place with oil paintings on the walls. The service was pretty warm and friendly and the menu looks more like it fits a breakfast place more than a lunch and dinner. For lunch and dinner, looks like you won't go far beyond sandwiches and burgers, so don't expect steak or rotisserie chicken.

I ordered the Corned Beef Hash and my girlfriend got the Popeye Omelet. I might not be fair to compare the Corned Beef Hash with Boulevard Cafe's, but it's necessary to contrast the portions. The Corned Beef is a third of what Boulevard would give. It's that small and if you haven't tried Boulevard's Corned Beef, I'll just say that they are generous with the meat! Well, moving on...my plate came with two eggs, two slices of bread and potatoes. The eggs were ordered over-easy and it looked fine, bread is bread...and the  potatoes were chunky. Potatoes were bland, but a little ketchup would fix it up some. The Corned Beef was fine. Not too salty, not too tasteless.

Overall, Cafe Rain Tree is passable, but it's nothing compared to other hard-hitter breakfast joints like the Squat and Gobble just down the street.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
This place is such a hole-in-the-wall. Sometimes, especially in this City, it's usually a good thing. This time, however... eh... not so much. But there's something about it that makes me go again and again.

True, the food can be pretty uninspiring. Nothing is ever great here. It averages from 'meh' to 'not too bad' to 'wow, this is kinda good'. The waitress is friendly... it seems to be the same waitress and it seems every time I come in there, she's wearing the same "Hecho En Mexico" t-shirt... which is pretty cool in my opinion... but it seems like she's the only waitress who works there... unless I'm coincidentally going there during her hours. Regardless, she's really cool.

Probably the best thing about this place is that you will NEVER have problems getting a table. For some reason, I like that in a place. If they had better food, maybe, it'll be a place where I go to more frequently and not an option only when Squat and Gobble is crowded.

I would suggest this place only if everywhere else you like to go in West Portal is crowded... or if you or some friends just want to eat,talk, and  hang out without worrying about a loud restaurant. Otherwise, you might be more satisfied going some place else.
author: Chris S.

description:
Meals always come with a side of indigestion. 
At its best, the food is mediocre. They don't know when to let things go in the kitchen--a few times now I've had blackened avocado and stale chips. The rate of staff turnover is faster than you can say "check, please", and the waitresses are always indifferent. 
We go here when we can't agree on anything else, and always kind of regret it after.
author: Meg I.

description:
Cafe Rain Tree is a great place to get an inexpensive meal. I read the other reviews and all the bad ones just sound like overly picky people. I mean come on, everyone makes mistakes! I eat here all the time and when the waitress makes a mistake on my order (happens sometimes) I tell her and she is always super nice about fixing it for me. 

The food is normal cafe food. It is table service so you can't go to a restaurant that has table service and be in a hurry! Sometimes the food comes out fast and sometimes slow but either way it's quite laid back and that's what I like. I'm not rushing out the door. But when I am in a bit of a hurry I just let the waitress know and she is petty good about making sure I get my food a bit faster. 

This place is pretty cool in my book. People shouldn't be so harsh!
author: Mary R.

description:
The burritos here are yummy and big enough for two!

I haven't had anything else on the menu, but my friends like the burgers.

If you're in the Portal, its lots of food for a good price.
author: Jessica P.

description: One of those places that even though the food is mediocre I like to go back once in a while. The Tuna melt is pretty good and the service is not bad, love West Portal and this is a nice affordable place to stop, nothing fancy just a simple cafe.
author: Ashim A.

description: Breakfast here is great but i wish they have browns instead  of the cubed potatoes. I love their mushroom burger it really hits the spot.  And the staff is always friendly.
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description:
Decent basic breakfast, served as fast as you please.  I recommend the sausage scrambles (I believe it's called "Joe's Special", but I could be wrong about that one).  Order them, then cover them in ketchup and/or tobasco.

I like to come here when I'm stuck eating alone and too lazy to be bothered with cooking.  Nice place to read a book and watch the foot traffic outside.
author: Kyle W.

description:
I went with a friend on a whim, the waitress seemed more interested in other things than serving us, but she was nice. I ordered a milkshake, and for some reason, when she brought it out to me, it was in 2 different glasses.  About 70% of the shake was in a classic milkshake glass, and the other 30% of the shake was in a small glass that looked kind of dirty (i didnt drink that part). 

I also asked for a glass of water, when she brought it to me, it was kind of warm, and it tasted like it was straight from the tap. Yucky. 

I ordered quesadillas, they were actually pretty good.. my friend ordered ham and cheese, she said i was just ok.
author: D F.

description:
Went here on a Sunday early evening with 5 people and there wasn't a single person in the house.  It made me slightly suspicious but it was the first cheap option on that entire street that we stumbled upon and a nice burger sounded amazing.  Crushed Ice alone gets a star.  Honestly, I can't remember the last time I was dished crushed ice by a restaurant.  I got the Royal Burger with a fried egg on it and WOW did it hit the spot.  
Taking this place for what it is, is important.  Greasy food, with a little unique flare to set it apart.  Call it mediocre, but how many places at this price can make a burger anything more than...a burger.  Seriously, if you're really hungry this place is GREAT.  It's not too special but it is a really solid greasy food place.
author: Adam S.

description:
Came here with my brother in which he had the Veggie Burger with fries while I had the Mushroom Burger with fries. They were good but not filling.

I think it is supposed to be a Vegetarian oriented restaurant it was good, but not great.
author: Alberto L.

description: Decent food. Extensive menu. Nothing fancy, but well executed.
author: Anthony R.

description:
Update: I somehow keep returning here for the salmon scramble (not listed on menu, but ALWAYS available as a "special"), and they have improved the service.The bathroom is still disgusting. That is all.

Just returned from a very bad breakfast experience here...we waited over a half hour after we ordered to get our food, and others who came in after us got theirs before us. Eggs do not take 1/2 hour to cook!! The waitress did not even apologize, nor did she offer us coffee or anything else while we waited. When the food finally came, the toast was cold. On top of that, the restroom is disgusting and a health hazard. I had been coming here for years occasionally, mostly because it's easy to get a table even on a weekend morning, and they have a salmon scramble that's decent. Those are no longer reasons enough to come here. There will always be a better option.
author: L J.

description: I ordered a crepe with sour cream - which turned out to be spoiled. When I discreetly alerted the owner, he tried the sour cream himself, and from my view at the counter I saw him throw it out, but then he came back and said to me that nothing was wrong with it. He then walked away and a waitress promptly handed a bill to me. I sat and waited for an uncomfortably long time, as all staff was then avoiding me, seeing as I wasn't eating, or dropping any money on the counter. The next time he came around I quietly repeated that I simply could not eat this food. He grumbled something and took the bill back.
author: Josephine L.

description: Went with my girlfriend. We are easy going people and fairly easy to please. We each gave one specific instruction with our orders and neither of our orders came out right. Service was slow. The food was whatever. Then, when I got my credit card statement, I was charged $5.53 higher than the bill. Basically the server gave herself a tip without me knowing... I still have the receipt to prove this. I decided that day that I would never go again and with the monetary issue I am now discouraging others of going there as well. There are plenty of other restaurants in the area that are great and will not give you issues. Don't go here!
author: Michael R.

description: I second Laura's review...what a terrible breakfast experience!  Mediocre food, inept service and lousy atmosphere = not a great way to start your day.  A little communication, goes a long way, when things go awry with the kitchen.  We were ignored, never offered refills, or an apology.  They did get the check to us in no time at all, though!
author: Loretta G.

description: Raintree is a benignly seedy option for your basic greasy-spoon breakfast or lunch, but I can't say that it has much going in its favor for either food or atmosphere.  Even the artwork on the wall is a leftover from the former establishment, Godzilla Burrito, as no one cared enough to bother getting up on a ladder to replace it.  To dine here is to rest secure in the knowledge that it's very hard to screw up scrambled eggs.
author: Hugh B.

description:
1 star rating07/14/2008 
I used to think this place was okay - average, but the last two times we were there, ick.  Here's what happened on our last visit:
We were there for lunch on a weekend with my two very young children.  It wasn't very crowded.  Our server was kind and took our order after we got ourselves situated.  My toddler was bored and hungry and it took way too long to get our food.  Some people who came in/ordered after us got their food before us.  There was a family of four that came in well after us... the server brought 3 plates out to them & I started to get up to leave, but my husband checked & our food was on it's way.  We did finally get served.  While we were eating, I noticed the mom was still waiting for her food - for a very long time.
Prior to that - while we were waiting so long - I saw one of the servers eating a buger behind the counter (hmmm, i ordered a burger & was still waiting) - wiping her mouth with her hand - making toast with her bare hands - serving food - picking up dirty dishes - handling payments - all without washing her hands once. ew.  Thank goodness the other woman brought us our food.

FYI - I'm pretty sure the chocolate milkshakes are made with Nestle Quik...  Costco sized buckets near the counter.  Shaw's next door has Mitchell's ice cream & does shakes+
author: lynn t.

description:
I had a yummy  Hawaiian burger with fries on the side. The food tasted excellent and the price looked reasonable. My friend ordered the crepe which looked much better than my burger. The waitress was good, the only reason why I rated this place a 4/5 instead of a 5/5 was because they ran out of ice cream. How can root beer float and milkshakes be on the menu if they don't have ice cream? 

Overall the food was the major plus here!
author: L H.

description: I had a crepe here and it was so good!  It had cheese, artichokes, tomatoes, olives, and onions.  It came with home fries that were also very good and tasty.  The food tasted very fresh and I felt like I was eating a home cooked meal.  I don't know about the other items on the menu, but the crepe was excellent.  I can't wait to try another crepe!
author: Kare V.

description: The food isn't so bad, although not very healthy, you know, Trans fatty acid, high fructose corn syrup, etc.  BUT, it's a good place to get a quick bite if you are hungry in the morning and it's so much better than eating fusion chinese a few doors down at XL.  By the way, this place need to clean up their bathroom often, it's kinda stinky even when nobody's using it.  So 2 stars is fair
author: Albert W.

description: I've always wondered how this place could be so busy. It's your basic greasy spoon so I decided to give it a try. Mid-morning, about 11am we were the only people there. The waitress was prompt, polite, and non-chatty. This is a big plus in the morning when you want food and coffee. I ordered pancakes that ended up being a little dry. My boyfriend ordered eggs scrambled that came over easy and bacon that came as sausage. They were polite enough to apologise but not polite enough to remake the food. We ate. Paid. We won't be returning. Two stars for prompt service.
author: Christian D.

description: The service is very friendly, but the food stinks. I've eaten at the other Rain Tree, and they're both the same- food is bland and tasteless. They also served us burnt potatoes and sausage. Hey, maybe the burgers are better? I won't be coming back to give it another try.
author: Sandra D.

description: OK, I must preface this review by saying that breakfast is my absolute favorite meal and I could eat it three times/day 7 days/week. So, I have only ordered breakfast at Raintree and it is always spectacular! If a cafe can be a hole-in-the-wall this may be considered one but it's great! Seating can be a challenge sometimes on the weekends but it's pretty much hit-or-miss. The servers are always really nice and you can change anything on the menu and they're cool with it. It's also kid-friendly, we've gone there with my niece and no one seems to mind if she decides to test out the latest words she's started saying over and over again.
author: Kristin D.

description: The cream had been on the table long enough to crawl into my coffee in coagulated lumps, literally must have been days. There was cream on every empty table at 4 pm.  New coffee,- from the fridge please, fresh cream .Should have been the first clue. The food took about an hour. When asked about the timing, our server decided to find a phone booth and put on her Superfrost costume. Eventually the one cook who was talking on the cellphone while cooking our food, came out from the kitchen to challenge one of my party.this was when a young couple came and asked how long we had waited. They left.  As the food arrived in phases, over two cups of coffee, and increasing bouts of grumpy inattention,  it was apparent that my French toast was cold. My friend asked about the avocados that were supposed to be in her omelette. She was told they were coming...she already had the omelette. Another cup of coffee later, I received the bananas for the French toast; a plate with a banana that was half way sliced and half left as a regular banana. We cancelled the order for the grilled cheese, since we were almost done. Right about then, the avocados showed up, the ones that were supposed to be in the omelette, along with the bill. We refused them as we were done eating. Oh yes. Understandably, as empty as it was I should l lower my expectations. The food did not crawl off my plate, though. It was just the cream.
author: Chuck L.

description: Sorry, but the burrito I had was quite dry; the rice was hard; the chicken was hard; I would much rather go to El Burrito on Taraval. Waitstaff was nice though, so two stars!
author: Audrey T.

description: Your slightly above average breakfast. Big omelettes with avocados and shrimp, crepes with different cheeses and onions, complete with potatoes and toast. Not bad.
author: M J.

description:
Cafe Rain Tree serves a great brunch, and the burgers are very tasty too. The wait staff are happy to make substitutions (try the Royal Burger with Irish bacon instead of the usual stuff) and service is quick.

The decor could use a little help, but with good, fresh food, you can overlook the formica tables.
author: Lisa E.

description: I would say just don't go here. I remember at one time the veggie scramble w/tofu was great. Yes,  the service is still friendly. Too bad when I took my son to the restroom another waitress cleared  our whole table after we ordered. I asked for no onions please  and of course there were extra onions. My sons cheese burger was excellent for the quality and taste of meat(I had to try it)  I will not return, chips and in the coffee cups too me are nasty.
author: Dee D.

description:
My boyfriend and I found ourselves here after the power went out in our building and the only breakfast-y thing we had in the apartment was a box of stale Honey Nut Cheerios.  Forgetting it was 10:30 on a Saturday, we hatched this brilliant scheme involving a quick trip to Squat and Gobble on West Portal before I had to hightail it to work.
Well, of course, we get there and the line at the counter is crowded up against the front door.  Having little time to come up with a plan B, we started walking down the street to see what else we could find.  We spotted Raintree Cafe, darted across the tracks, and went inside.
Perhaps sheer hunger wrote this review, but I daresay everything about the experience was great.  The food wasn't fantastic, but was everything I was looking for at that time.  I got the banana pancakes, and they were very, very good, but I get this feeling that they shouldn't be trusted with sandwiches or anything other than breakfast fare.  I don't know why; I just do.  Weird art on the walls, very quick service, and the coffee, though far from gourmet, packs one serious punch.  It was the first time I've ever actually felt a marked difference in my demeanor from downing a cup of coffee in a hurry.  The service was so fast, I got out of there with a whole hour before I had to get to work.  All in all, decent food for decent prices.  If Squat and Gobble is looking full, and since Cafe For All Seaons is in a state of serious decline since undergoing new management, park yourself at Raintree Cafe.
author: Jody A.

description: This place isn't really the best place to eat, but it's accessible to me when I need a grilled cheese and I appreciate their accessibility.
author: Morence L.

description: This place was a major disappointment. I ordered the breakfast raintree special to go, which included pancakes, eggs, and sausage along with a side order of home fries. I was really looking forward to the home fries but when I got home, I had noticed that they forgot to give them to me. They either forgot to make the order or put it in the bag. Regardless of how it happened, that was unacceptable. The eggs were really watery for some reason too. It was so bad I didn't I eat anymore more of  it after that one bite. It was the worse eggs I have ever eaten in my life. I will never eat there ever again, This was a bad experience and a waste of money.
author: Sophia L.

description:
this place is horrible. it needs to be shut down.

me and 2 of my friends ordered the surf n turf burrito. after waiting 25 mins for it, when we opened the inside it looked like cat food. seriously, it look like they poured "fancy feast" cat food tuna in the toritilla and rolled it up with rice and beans. the soda also tasted the same. i had a sprite, my friends had a coke, yet they tasted the same. as if the soda machine mixed all the flavors together. also, they had the nerve to give us 8 chips to go with the burrito. EIGHT CHIPS. we asked for more because 8 tortilla chips is ridiculous. the waiter had a serious attitude and we ended up leaving the barely eaten food there.

we also left a note saying "this was disgusting" just to let them know.

HORRIBLE FOOD AND RUDE SERVICE. I SHOULDA WENT TO MCDONALDS. SAVE YOUR MONEY PEOPLE & DONT BOTHER WITH THIS PLACE!
author: sd f.

description: This is an excellent place to sit in the morning if you need an uncrowded place to meet someone for coffee and you're not too picky about the coffee.   It's surrounded by crowded cafes so it's a convenient place to duck in out of the crowd.  You might want to avoid the omelettes, which seem to be made with  canned vegetables and velveeta.
author: David H.

description: i love the belgian waffle. and they have a good variety of omelettes. their style of country hash browns is a little different but is still good. service is very friendly and ive never had to wait for a seat. sometimes its hard to find parking. but you just need to feed the parking meter for one hour and you'll be fine.
author: jenn h.

description: had breakfast here on Tuesday.   gave us upset stomach and think the food wasnt fresh.  home potatoes were like left over heated up with too much paprika...very stodgy.  good thing the plate wasnt too greasy and the eggs cooked over med.  service was super friendly but given we had upset stomach- only 2 stars
author: May M.

description:
finally, a place with exactly the number of stars it deserves. i mean the owners don't care about this place so much that they won't even write fake reviews to even out the bad ones.

me and my girlfriend went here before we went out for the day, there was a special of 8.95 for a super burrito, so we planned to split it.

we order it, after waiting a bit, and it comes, it looks ok from the outside, but we cut it in half, and i kid you not, the burrito was 75% tortilla, and probably one scrambled egg (i'm being generous here) and some salsa and maybe some cheese, but BARELY any of any of it. 

i told the waitress and she didn't offer anything, and we spent pretty much all our money so i asked if we could get a side of eggs instead of the burrito. after an awkward silence she got it for us. but there wasn't that much and the eggs were doused in what tasted like cheap cooking oil.

i almost gave this place 2 stars because they gave us the eggs instead but i think the other stuff made it so bad it deserves one star.
author: san francisco k.

description: Cheap, good food. All these other d-bags that thumbs-downed this place need to remember that it isn't the ritz-carlton. For it's class it's a winner. If you want splendid culinary excellence I'm sorry but you might have to shell out more than $10 for breakfast you tool.
author: sizuck m.
